thread.title: Third streetcar shipped in from Portland for Loop Trolley
thread.title_full: Third streetcar shipped in from Portland for Loop Trolley

author: Nassim Benchaabane St. Louis Post-Dispatch
title: Third streetcar shipped in from Portland for Loop Trolley
text:
Close Nassim Benchaabane 
The Loop Trolley's first trolley car arrived in St. Louis on Thursday, Feb. 16, 2017. Photo courtesy of the Loop Trolley Company. Third streetcar shipped in from Portland for Loop Trolley ( … ) Nassim Benchaabane 
The Loop Trolley's first trolley car arrived in St. Louis on Thursday, Feb. 16, 2017. Photo courtesy of the Loop Trolley Company. 
ST. LOUIS • A third streetcar for the Loop Trolley arrived in St. Louis Thursday. 
The car is one of two refurbished 1990s replicas of 1903 streetcars used on the Portland Vintage Trolley service in Portland, Oregon. The second car is expected to arrive in coming weeks. 
The car was delivered to St. Louis by flatbed truck after it competed weeks of testing in Iowa. It is now housed in the Loop Trolley headquarters on Delmar Boulevard, where it awaits test runs on the tracks. 
The car's original seating layout was changed, and wheelchair lifts were installed onto each end platform. 
The Loop Trolley is a 2.2-mile, $51 million trolley running along Delmar Boulevard that will connect the Delmar Loop to Forest Park. Construction of the trolley line is complete but passenger service won't begin until late spring. 
Two vintage green trolleys from Seattle were shipped to St. Louis in June. A third car from Seattle will be delivered in spring. 
The cars, which include wood-panel interiors and brass hardware, used to run on the George Benson Waterfront Streetcar Line in Seattle. Together the three Seattle trolleys cost about $200,000 total. Tags
